title: Axiom of dependent choice
summary: In mathematics, the axiom of dependent choice, denoted by D C {\displaystyle {\mathsf {DC}}} , is a weak form of the axiom of choice ( A C {\displaystyle {\mathsf {AC}}} ) that is still sufficient to develop most of real analysis. It was introduced by Paul Bernays in a 1942 article that explores which set-theoretic axioms are needed to develop analysis.[lower-alpha 1]
